bug.author: vfdev-5
bug.summary: Unexpected keyword argument 'experiment_name' in Neptune logger
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug description</denchmark-h>
I instantiate the logger as npt_logger = npt_module.NeptuneLogger( api_token=api_token, project_name="vfdev-5/my_project", experiment_name="test", params=config ) and I get the error <denchmark-code>TypeError: create_experiment() got an unexpected keyword argument 'experiment_name' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jakubczakon>@jakubczakon</denchmark-link> any ideas why it happens ? <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.4): 1.4 Ignite Version (e.g., 0.3.0): 0.4.0.dev20200418

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/vfdev-5>@vfdev-5</denchmark-link> I am looking into it right away.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jakubczakon>@jakubczakon</denchmark-link> thanks ! I have another question about why when logging text (.log_text) in UI all \n are removed ?

I have another question about why when logging text (.log_text) in UI all \n are removed?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/pitercl>@pitercl</denchmark-link> could you look into that?

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/vfdev-5>@vfdev-5</denchmark-link> , yes, this is a part of the reasoning. Other reason is that the mechanism of scrolling text logs in our UI is actually farily complex and relies on each log being a single line. We might change that in the future, however, if we get enough push from our users :)
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/pitercl>@pitercl</denchmark-link> well, maybe it is not appropriate place to ask, but can we log somehow stdout with Neptune and avoid using ?
